Race.SpecificTitle: Delachaise Security and Improvement Dist. -- $300 Parcel Fee - CC - 3 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Delachaise Security and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans impose and collect a special annual fee, called the Delachaise Security and Improvement District ("District") fee, on each parcel of land in the District (from Louisiana Avenue and Carondelet Street, proceeding along Carondelet Street (both sides) to Marengo Street, along Marengo Street (both sides) to South Saratoga Street, then along South Saratoga Street (both sides) to Louisiana Avenue, and along Louisiana Avenue (interior side) back to Carondelet Street), except parcels whose owner(s) qualifies for the special assessment level provided by Louisiana Constitution Article VII, Section 18(G)(1), in the amount of and not exceeding three hundred dollars ($300.00), for three (3) years beginning January 1, 2020 and ending December 31, 2022, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $90,000.00 annually, to be used solely and exclusively to aid in crime prevention by providing security for District residents and to serve their needs by funding other activities and improvements for the overall betterment of the District, except a 1% City collection fee, which additional law enforcement or security personnel and their services shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Oak Island Neighborhood Imp. Dist. -- $150 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans impose and collect a special annual fee, called the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District fee, on each improved parcel of land in the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District (Michoud Boulevard, from Adventure Drive to Expedition Drive (both sides), to Explorer Avenue, to Voyageur Drive and Voyageur Court (both sides), to Horizon Drive (both sides) to Pierre Court (both sides); also Michoud Boulevard; to W. Cavelier Drive (both sides), to Trapper Court (both sides), to St. Marie Court (both sides) and N. Cavelier Drive (both sides)), except parcels whose owner(s) qualified for the special assessment level provided by Louisiana Constitution Article VII, Section 18(G)(1), in the amount of and not exceeding one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00), for four (4) years beginning January 1, 2020 and ending December 31, 2023, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $45,000.00 annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage the security, beautification and overall betterment of Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District, except a 1% City collection fee, which additional security and services shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the district by the state, city, or other political subdivisions?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Barrington Subdivision Imp. Dist. -- $350 Parcel Fee Renewal - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans renew the levy of the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District's ("District") annual Parcel Fee in the amount of three hundred fifty dollars ($350) per year on each parcel of taxable real property located within the District, which is that area of the City of New Orleans whose boundaries are coterminous with the boundaries of the Lake Barrington Subdivision, as specified in City Council Resolution R-19-169, for a period of eight (8) years, commencing January 1, 2020 and ending December 31, 2027, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $71,400 annually, to be used for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security, and overall betterment of the Lake Barrington Subdivision Improvement District, as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the District, which security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?
